item.title: Indie Stores
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: I’ve been wanting to do a comic like this for years, it’s honestly been in the making for about 6 months! Really happy to finally have it up and done and on the site. Was lovely to have Erika draw up a slice of Gene Wilder too =) There is such a huge network of […]
item.content:encoded:
Indie Stores

by Matthew Nolan on 07/20/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics

I’ve been wanting to do a comic like this for years, it’s honestly been in the making for about 6 months! Really happy to finally have it up and done and on the site. Was lovely to have Erika draw up a slice of Gene Wilder too =)

There is such a huge network of indie-sex-toy makers and companies out there, and our list is just the tip of a humongously perverted iceberg. Hopefully, today’s comic gets to those of you who are looking for something creative, fantastical, and different. While we might not be able to vouch for every indie-maker out there, the 6 we worked with on today’s comic all sent us fast and amazingly crafted toys – all highly recommended.

In no particular order:

Strange Bedfellas
  • Store
  • Twitter

Dread the Empire

  • Site
  • Store
  • Twitter

Funkit Toys

  • Store
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

KuduVoodoo

  • Store
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

Twilight Meadow Creations

  • Store
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

Weredog

  • Store
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

Mentioned briefly, but worth repeating – a lot of these guys are SMALL teams; some even just one or two people, so they’ll make their toys in limited-run-batches and release them in batches. If a store looks empty, check out their socials. Good things come to those who wait!

item.title: Top Surgery by Jey Pawlik
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Thank you so much for cracking this intimate topic open, Jey! As ever if you’re interested in this procedure, do a bunch more research on your own too! Prices, doctor-consultations, surgeon’s methods; all that stuff changes with time and location. Jey’s comic is an awesome primer from someone with first-hand experience, but might not reflect […]
item.content:encoded:
Top Surgery by Jey Pawlik

by Matthew Nolan on 07/13/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Health

Thank you so much for cracking this intimate topic open, Jey!

As ever if you’re interested in this procedure, do a bunch more research on your own too! Prices, doctor-consultations, surgeon’s methods; all that stuff changes with time and location. Jey’s comic is an awesome primer from someone with first-hand experience, but might not reflect the hoops you have to jump through yourself. We recommend reading up about ‘mastectomies’ and ‘subtotal mastectomies’. Scarleteen also has a good piece focused on surgical transition options from 2016 (and a smaller piece focused on subtotal mastectomies.) But finding something more current and dialed into your local options would probably be a better place to start (try and find your nearest local LGBTQ+ support group and reach out).

Get more Jey here;

  • Portfolio
  • Wecomics
  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Also, this isn’t their first OJST-rodeo! Fancy reading more Jey Pawlik comics? Take a peek at their amazing comic on Binders and this sexy space comic.

└ Tags: augmentation, autobio, Chest, education, guest, guest comic, Jey Pawlik, mastectomies, mastectomy, nonbinary, peri-areolar, reconstruction, subtotal mastectomy, surgery, t-anchor, Top Surgery, transition

item.title: Dirty Talk
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: We hope you find it helpful. Especially for those of you looking to up your vocal game, or those who are running into the barrier of ‘WHAT should I say next’. We know it’s not for everyone too, so advocate your wants and needs fam; explore dirty talk only if it’s something that grabs you. […]
item.content:encoded:
Dirty Talk

by Matthew Nolan on 07/06/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • How To

We hope you find it helpful. Especially for those of you looking to up your vocal game, or those who are running into the barrier of ‘WHAT should I say next’. We know it’s not for everyone too, so advocate your wants and needs fam; explore dirty talk only if it’s something that grabs you. Here’s a few more in-depth articles that offer some helpful tips and prompts!

► A Beginner’s Guide to Talking Dirty Virtually or IRL
► How To Talk Dirty During Sex, On The Phone & Whenever
► Exactly How to Talk Dirty During Sex Without Feeling Awkward

Erika and I are still trying to figure out a potential time for a sabbatical break. Yesterday we made a list of our priorities and commitments; there are a certain number of toys we need to get done before we can have a major break. Erika’s doing a trip in August so maybe we extend it into an official break. Or maybe in September when the Sponsorship is due to expire, we’ll take a sleepy break. We’re not sure yet, but at least we’re one step further in the process. Turns out finding a time to ‘stop’ and take a ‘break’ when both your self-employed livelihoods are on the line is hella tough!

Talking of which – I’m always taking paid guest comic submissions!

└ Tags: advocate, conversation, describe, dirty talk, moans, noise, observation, ridiculous, sound, statement, talk, vocal verbalize

item.title: Exploring Orgasms by eRomameRo
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: eRomameRo is here filling in for us today, as we MELT AWAY into nothing (as of this moment it’s 110F outside 0_o ). Sometimes life comes at you in different ways, and so this lovely comic took a few years to make, and be ready for posting, but we’re oh-so-happy to have it and finally […]
item.content:encoded:
Exploring Orgasms by eRomameRo

by Matthew Nolan on 06/29/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics

eRomameRo is here filling in for us today, as we MELT AWAY into nothing (as of this moment it’s 110F outside 0_o ).

Sometimes life comes at you in different ways, and so this lovely comic took a few years to make, and be ready for posting, but we’re oh-so-happy to have it and finally share it. Drawn by eRomameRo from their OC Mames perspective, on their journey of self-discovery. I think it’s stunning and touching.

It has me reflecting on Erika’s older comics abut her first experiences. Check out Erika’s Bullet Vibe Comic and essay on Babeland. Then, for bonus points read Bingo’s comic on their experience ‘bating!

Go tell eRomameRo how awesome they are!

  • Twitter

Erika and I are still in ‘trying to figure out the future’ mode. This mad weather has kind of put a stop to any critical thinking, so hopefully, when things cool off by the end of the week, I can finally finish up work on next weeks comic (it just needs a lot of editing), AND come up with a master plan for the next year! Wish us luck!

If you’re in the PNW – stay safe, drink water, and keep ‘batin ;D

└ Tags: anthro, autobio, eRomameRo, furry, guest, guest comic, toy, vibe, vibrator

item.title: The Ridiculous
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Sneaking in this gorgeous Erika Patreon Autobio comic for you all this week! Erika and I have been slamming our heads into a ‘Dirty Talk’ comic this past 2 weeks. Rewriting and drawing it so many times, really trying to find the comic in it. The problem lies with our nature to want to expand […]
item.content:encoded:
The Ridiculous

by Matthew Nolan on 06/22/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Favorites

Sneaking in this gorgeous Erika Patreon Autobio comic for you all this week!

Erika and I have been slamming our heads into a ‘Dirty Talk’ comic this past 2 weeks. Rewriting and drawing it so many times, really trying to find the comic in it. The problem lies with our nature to want to expand the idea into a WHOLE thing about ‘communication’ which could be like… 1,000 pages, rather than a short 4-5 page comic. Short succinct comics are hard ya’ll! Anyway, we’re exhausted, that comic isn’t ready yet, and we need a break. So, we’re taking a mental health week off, gonna come back to it fresher later on. Heck, we’ve even started talking about taking a longer sabbatical at some point; with working together under one roof without major breaks for all of Covid, it’s been hard to get away from constant ‘OJST-mode’. It’s got us needing a break and thinking about the future in a healthy mental way.

In the meantime you get this LOVELY comic Erika put together a while ago for her $3 (per OJST update) Patreon patrons. If you like this sort of Erika’s-thoughts-comics and want to see us continue making OJST’s, please consider joining up on our Patreon, truly, truly – every little helps!

└ Tags: autobio, kohlrabi, korabi

item.title: Hair Confidence by Devils
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Devils debuts on OJST with this sweet, personal story about cutting her hair short for the first time! Man, reading this took me back to the first time I shaved my head in college and what a transformative experience that was. At the start of the quarantine, I decided to let my hair grow out […]
item.content:encoded:
Hair Confidence by Devils

by Matthew Nolan on 06/15/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Interviews

Devils debuts on OJST with this sweet, personal story about cutting her hair short for the first time! Man, reading this took me back to the first time I shaved my head in college and what a transformative experience that was. At the start of the quarantine, I decided to let my hair grow out until I got vaccinated. By the time I was getting my shot, my hair was well past my shoulders and I had spent the last year under lockdown not recognizing myself in the mirror. Finally, getting to hack all that heavy hair away earlier this month? I know what Devils means when she writes “It was like the haircut had freed me.” in her comic.

People have such deeply personal relationships with their hair and we’ve got a few more comics on the topic in our archives here at ol’ Oh Joy Sex Toy! Give’em a gander:
Body Hair Blues by Tess Thompson

Body Hair Blues by Tess Thompson

item.title: FleshSack
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: I’ve been looking forward to this review for months and months. When I first ran into the FleshSack (yes I know, that name 0_o), I thought it was some sort of FleshLight Aprils fools. It seemed so out of place amongst all the orifice-focused toys they make, and definitely not something that would appeal to […]
item.content:encoded:
FleshSack

by Matthew Nolan on 06/08/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

I’ve been looking forward to this review for months and months.

When I first ran into the FleshSack (yes I know, that name 0_o), I thought it was some sort of FleshLight Aprils fools. It seemed so out of place amongst all the orifice-focused toys they make, and definitely not something that would appeal to me. But I was shocked by how much horny mental space it decided to occupy in my head. Balls on a Fleshlight; after all… why not? Why shouldn’t I keep try it? What started as a giggle turned into a must have. I HAD to experience those balls slappin’ up against me. A rare purchase for me.

And gosh was I not disappointed. This toy exudes FUN. Sure, there are better toys out there, but are they as much FUN to slap up against? I’m not sure.

This comic makes me miss going to our local She Bop SO friggin’ MUCH!

It was an absolute delight to get today’s saucy nsfw comic from G! It’s just the right flavor and speed for the start of the summer- from what I’ve been reading, it’s supposed to be a horny summer, too, with more and more folks reappearing from the lockdown full vaccinated and feeling amorous. I hope today’s comic inspires! =D

Go tell G they’re awesome!

Erika and I took last week off as we dealt with the second covid vaccination (short story: it wiped us OUT), slowly getting back into the roll of the schedule!

item.title: Tenga Geo
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: You know what. I ain’t afraid to say it. I friggin LOVE the Geo. Love LOVE. It’s strange – I never expected to find a line of toys that would ‘connect’ to me when I started reviewing for OJST. I always thought that a toy was a toy, some would be better than others, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Tenga Geo

by Matthew Nolan on 05/18/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

You know what. I ain’t afraid to say it. I friggin LOVE the Geo. Love LOVE.

It’s strange – I never expected to find a line of toys that would ‘connect’ to me when I started reviewing for OJST. I always thought that a toy was a toy, some would be better than others, and my donger wouldn’t be particular either way. But over the years I’ve developed a better sense of what it is exactly that me and my willy like best. It turns out it’s LOOKS and TEXTURES. Both of which Tenga is KING.

I can’t recommend the Geo enough (for those with average or smaller cocks.) However, it’s not widely stocked and might wear out quickly. If you don’t mind the same experience but shaped in a TUBE rather than an ORB (which hasn’t ever ‘torn’ for me) – I can 100% recommend Geo’s younger sibling, the 3D (reviewed here in 2013!!!) if you can find it; most folks we work with in the menu-bar stock it!

Tila’s just wonderful and deserves all of your follows and kind words.

  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Tomorrow – May 12th



Come to our free, live book chat with Emily Nagoski through Charis Books tomorrow!!! We’re gunna be talking about our book for teens about sex and relationships, Let’s Talk About It.

Wednesday, May 12th @ Charis Books

4:30pm PST / 7:30pm EDT


If you’ve read through our archives or, y’know, pay attention to the New York Times Best Sellers lists, you won’t wanna miss our talk with Emily Nagoski. She is the award-winning author of the New York Times bestselling Come As You Are and The Come As You Are Workbook, and coauthor, with her sister, Amelia, of New York Times bestseller Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle. She earned an M.S. in counseling and a Ph.D. in health behavior, both from Indiana University, with clinical and research training at the Kinsey Institute.
Register for our Crowdcast chat at Charis Books.

└ Tags: break time, breaktime, fantasy, fiction, guest, guest comic, nswf, Perkytiddies09, Tila, work
